jobs.title: Director, M&A Integration
jobs.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">At Ripple, we’re building a world where value moves like information does today. It’s big, it’s bold, and we’re already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">If you’re ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.</span></p></div><div> <p><strong>THE WORK:</strong></p> <p>Ripple is seeking an experienced and strategic leader who is dedicated to execution for leading the planning and implementation of M&amp;A integrations. This role sits within the Strategic Initiatives team and will lead cross-functional efforts to integrate acquired companies in a way that accelerates product and market outcomes, preserves talent and culture, and enhances return on investment.<br>You will work closely with executive partners - including Product, Engineering, Legal, Finance, People, and GTM leaders - to develop integration strategies grounded in deal rationale, and ensure successful execution from signing through post-close.<br>Reporting to our VP, Strategic Initiatives, the Director of M&amp;A Integration operates as an individual contributor in the team.<br>You’re at your best in a fast-changing environment with plenty of ambiguity and interesting, challenging problems to tackle.<strong><br></strong></p> <p><strong>WHAT YOU’LL DO:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Serve as the integration lead for acquisitions, partnering with business leads and functional owners to translate deal rationale into an actionable integration strategy.</li> <li>Define and drive integration priorities, workstreams, and timelines across all phases: pre-sign diligence, signing-to-close planning, and post-close execution.</li> <li>Craft integration plans with functional leaders, align executives on priorities, and anticipate obstacles.</li> <li>Nurture strong cross-functional relationships to align teams, surface risks and opportunities early, and drive coordinated execution across workstreams.</li> <li>Lead cross-functional working teams, facilitate efficient decision-making, manage risks and interdependencies, and ensure delivery against integration objectives.</li> <li>Ensure acquired teams are set up for success - supporting onboarding, team structure, cultural alignment, and retention of key talent.</li> <li>Deliver high-quality, executive-ready communication to maintain alignment, highlight progress, and advance issues as needed.</li> </ul> </div> <div> <p><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BRING:&nbsp;</strong></p> </div> <div> <ul> <li>10–15 years of experience in program management or corporate development, with a minimum of 5 years leading M&amp;A integrations end-to-end - ideally within B2B or FinTech environments.</li> <li>Proven track record leading cross-functional integration for sophisticated deals (e.g., product tuck-ins, geographic expansion, acqui-hires).</li> <li>Extensive experience leading both pre-sign diligence and post-close integration, with a strong grasp of how early insights should advise integration strategy and how integration plans should guide diligence priorities.</li> <li>Proven ability to translate high-level strategic goals into clear execution plans, especially in fast-moving or ambiguous environments.</li> <li>Experience collaborating with executive leadership and navigating multiple collaborator perspectives.</li> <li>Deep experience aligning product, tech, GTM, and back-office functions to deliver cohesive, high-impact integrations.</li> <li>Excellent project management, communication, and change leadership skills, with a consistent track record to lead by influence across cross-functional teams and senior partners.</li> <li>Highly organized, low-ego, resourceful, and willing to take action, with a bias toward clarity, execution, and collaboration.</li> <li>Experience in blockchain, payments, or digital asset infrastructure.</li> </ul> </div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description">For positions that will be based in CA, the annual salary range for this position is

jobs.title: Android System Engineer
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States, Remote, San Francisco, California, United States
jobs.description: <h2><strong>Who We Are</strong></h2> <p>Solana is a high performance blockchain that can deliver a fast and friendly user experience, without sacrificing security.<br><br>At Solana Mobile, we are working to bring Solana and web3 to the palm of your hand on mobile. In 2023 we shipped the Saga phone with Seed Vault to secure Solana wallets with HW backed security and built the dApp Store as a developer friendly place to bring web3 apps to users. We also implement and provide the Solana Mobile Stack to developers to simplify building web3 dApps for mobile. In 2025 we continued this journey with the release of Seeker, which has shipped to 150k customers in 50+ countries.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Solana Labs, Inc. (“Solana Labs”) is a technology company that builds products, tools, and reference implementations that can be used on the Solana blockchain. Solana Mobile is a dedicated team within Solana Labs. We are a fully distributed team with offices in San Francisco and New York.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>The Opportunity</strong></p> <p>We’re looking for a <strong>Senior System Software Engineer (Android)</strong> to lead the design and implementation of secure, cryptographically sound Android-based platforms for interacting with the Solana blockchain. You will have broad ownership of Android system-level components, collaborating across hardware abstraction layers, trusted execution environments, and the Android OS stack.</p> <p>This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of <strong>Android system development, applied cryptography, and blockchain</strong> technology.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <h2><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Design and implement a secure cryptographic solution tailored for Android smartphones.</li> <li>Develop the UI layer for transaction authorization and signing on Solana.</li> <li>Create API interfaces to interact with blockchain software wallets.</li> <li>Build and maintain a system service responsible for transaction validation, key setup, and key management</li> <li>Work with partners to implement and maintain the Trusted App for secure key generation and signing.</li> <li>Collaborate with software and hardware partners and oversee their development deliverables.</li> <li>Integrate with the broader Solana Mobile Android application ecosystem.</li> <li>Design and build Android UI components, system services, and compliance test suites.</li> <li>Create and maintain automated test harnesses using Android Cuttlefish virtual devices.</li> <li>Take end-to-end ownership of Android system software activities: design, implementation, and integration.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Strong proficiency in <strong>C, C++, Java, </strong>and<strong> Kotlin</strong>.</li> <li>Deep understanding of Android architecture, especially <strong>system services </strong>and<strong> hardware abstraction layers (HALs)</strong>.</li> <li><strong>2+ years</strong> of experience in Android system software development.</li> <li><strong>5+ years</strong> of total professional software engineering experience.</li> <li>Solid foundation in <strong>applied cryptography</strong> and <strong>Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs)</strong>.</li> <li>Experience working with or integrating secure hardware and vendor SDKs.</li> <li>Ability to lead cross-functional development and integration efforts.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Nice to Have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Familiarity with Android Cuttlefish or similar virtual devices.</li> <li>Interest or experience in <strong>blockchain</strong> applications and ecosystem tools.</li> <li>Contributions to open-source Android or security-related projects.</li> </ul>

jobs.title: Contractor, Social Media Manager, Speedrun
jobs.description: <p>Founded in Silicon Valley in 2009 by Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz, Andreessen Horowitz (aka a16z) is a venture capital firm that backs bold entrepreneurs <a href="https://a16z.com/news-content">building the future</a> through technology. a16z has $46B in assets under management across multiple funds. We’ve invested in<a href="https://a16z.com/portfolio/"> companies</a> like Affirm, Airbnb, Coinbase, Databricks, Figma, GitHub, Instacart, Pinterest, Roblox, Stripe, and Substack.</p> <p>a16z <a href="https://speedrun.a16z.com/">speedrun</a> is the firm’s program to invest in, and help, new startups. We run a 2x/year program that spans 12 weeks, with dozens of startups working out of a16z’s offices in SF and LA. So far we've invested in over <a href="https://speedrun.a16z.com/companies">150 startups</a> with $180M+ in capital deployed.</p> <h2>The Role</h2> <p>We are seeking a creative and driven contract Social Media Manager to lead our efforts in building and engaging our online community. This role is essential to amplifying our brand, fostering relationships, and driving engagement with our audience. The Community and Social Media Manager will be responsible for developing and executing social media strategies, managing content creation, and nurturing our community of followers.</p> <p>This role requires an in-office presence 2-3 days a week in our San Francisco, CA office.&nbsp;</p> <h2>To join our team, you should be excited to:</h2> <ul> <li><strong>Social Media Strategy:</strong> Develop and implement comprehensive social media strategies that align with SPEEDRUN’s brand and objectives. Focus on increasing engagement, growing our audience, and enhancing our online presence.</li> <li><strong>Content Creation:</strong> Create, curate, and manage high-quality content across all social media platforms, including posts, videos, stories, and blogs. Ensure content is aligned with our brand voice and resonates with our target audience.</li> <li><strong>Community Engagement:</strong> Actively engage with our community across social media platforms, responding to comments, messages, and discussions in a timely and professional manner. Foster a positive and inclusive community environment.</li> <li><strong>Campaign Management:</strong> Plan and execute social media campaigns that promote our programs, events, and key initiatives. Track and analyze campaign performance, making data-driven decisions to optimize results.</li> <li><strong>Collaboration:</strong> Work closely with the marketing, content, and program teams to ensure consistent messaging and alignment with broader marketing strategies.</li> <li><strong>Analytics &amp; Reporting:</strong> Monitor social media metrics and provide regular reports on performance, insights, and trends. Use data to inform and refine strategies for continuous improvement.</li> </ul> <h2>Minimum Qualifications</h2> <ul> <li><strong>Experience:</strong> 7+ years of experience in social media management, community building, or digital marketing, preferably within the tech or gaming industries.</li> <li><strong>Creativity:</strong> A creative thinker with the ability to generate fresh ideas for content and engagement that resonate with our audience.</li> <li><strong>Communication Skills:</strong> Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with a strong understanding of how to engage diverse online communities.</li> <li><strong>Technical Skills:</strong> Proficiency with social media platforms, content management systems, and analytics tools. Experience with graphic design or video editing is a plus.</li> <li><strong>Passion for Tech, Entertainment, &amp; AI:</strong> A deep passion for the tech, entertainment, and AI industries, with a strong understanding of the culture and community within these spaces.</li> <li><strong>Self-Motivation:</strong> A self-starter with the ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.</li> </ul> <p>The anticipated hourly range for this role is between $75.00 - $87.00, actual starting pay may vary based on a range of factors which can include experience, skills, and scope.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>a16z culture&nbsp;</strong></h2> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We do only first class business and only in a first class way</span>&lt

jobs.title: Director of Security Engineering
jobs.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">At Ripple, we’re building a world where value moves like information does today. It’s big, it’s bold, and we’re already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">If you’re ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.</span></p></div><p><strong>THE WORK:</strong></p> <p>As the Director of Security Engineering, you will be responsible for building and leading a dedicated, humble, and paranoid team of Security Engineers to secure Ripple's products, infrastructure, and corporate IT systems. You will play a substantial role in defining the security strategy and encouraging a culture of security across the entire company. Your leadership will be crucial in protecting our business and our customers by embedding security into every layer of our technology stack.</p> <p><strong>WHAT YOU'LL DO:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Set the strategic vision and roadmap for the Security Engineering team, focusing on product security, infrastructure security, and IT security.</li> <li>Lead, mentor, and strengthen a team of security engineers, cultivating an atmosphere that values technical excellence, continual learning, and innovation.</li> <li>Serve as a security domain expert, providing guidance and communicating security risks and concepts to senior leadership, engineering teams, and other partners.</li> <li>Drive the implementation of security guidelines across the engineering organization, ensuring security is integrated into day-to-day development processes.</li> <li>Collaborate with engineering, product, and IT leadership to ensure alignment on security priorities and to champion security outcomes on behalf of our customers.</li> </ul> <p><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BRING:</strong></p> <ul> <li>12+ years of experience in security engineering, with at least 5+ years in a leadership or management role, preferably in the crypto, blockchain, or FinTech space.</li> <li>Expert-level knowledge of security architecture, including cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure), modern application stacks, and network security.</li> <li>Strong understanding of cryptographic principles, secure coding practices, and common web and blockchain vulnerabilities (e.g., OWASP Top 10).</li> <li>Experience with authentication and authorization standards (OAuth, SAML, OIDC) and their security implications.</li> <li>Demonstrated expertise in IT security, including endpoint protection, network security, identity and access management (IAM), and corporate security policy enforcement.</li> <li>Hands-on experience with threat modeling methodologies and risk identification techniques.</li> <li>Ability to communicate complex technical concepts and security risks to both technical and non-technical audiences.</li> <li>A track record of fostering a positive security culture within an organization and proven experience leading and building a high-performing security team.</li> <li>Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to effectively and creatively manage complex security challenges.</li> </ul><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description">For positions that will be based in CA, the annual salary range for this position is below. Actual salaries may vary based on numerous factors including, among other things, an individual applicant’s experience and qualifications for the position. jobs.title: Associate Manager, Compliance
jobs.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Ready to be pushed beyond what you think you’re capable of?</p> <p>At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom in the world. It’s a massive, ambitious opportunity that demands the best of us, every day, as we build the emerging onchain platform — and with it, the future global financial system.</p> <p>To achieve our mission, we’re seeking a very specific candidate. We want someone who is passionate about our mission and who believes in the power of crypto and blockchain technology to update the financial system. We want someone who is eager to leave their mark on the world, who relishes the pressure and privilege of working with high caliber colleagues, and who actively seeks feedback to keep leveling up. We want someone who will run towards, not away from, solving the company’s hardest problems.</p> <p>Our <a href="https://www.coinbase.com/mission">work culture</a> is intense and isn’t for everyone. But if you want to build the future alongside others who excel in their disciplines and expect the same from you, there’s no better place to be.</p> <p>While many roles at Coinbase are remote-first, we are not remote-only. In-person participation is required throughout the year. Team and company-wide offsites are held multiple times annually to foster collaboration, connection, and alignment. Attendance is expected and fully supported.</p></div><p>The Compliance team within Customer Experience (CX) is responsible for developing and delivering best in class support across multiple customer segments. The Global Compliance Operations Team is responsible for executing Compliance controls with adherence to Coinbase’s BSA/AML program, transaction monitoring, KYC, CDD, and EDD policies, procedures and standards appropriate for each jurisdiction in which Coinbase operates. As a Compliance Support Supervisor, you will lead a team of 10-15 Compliance Analysts responsible for enhanced due diligence (EDD), transaction monitoring, to include preparation and filing of Suspicious Activity Reports (SAR). The supervisor sets a culture of ownership and customer focus on their teams by supporting individual and team goals and ensuring best in class customer service experiences through the team. Supervisors also identify broader customer impacting issues and work with technical and nontechnical teams to implement solutions to drive quality and productivity of operations.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What you’ll be doing:</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Lead a team of 10-15 Compliance (Transaction Monitoring / AML and Fraud Investigations/EDD) Analysts;&nbsp;</li> <li>Ensure adherence to operational KPIs from directs and vendor partners&nbsp; or overall performance and the quality.&nbsp;</li> <li>Coordinate with senior management and provide insights for process improvement.</li> <li>Communicate effectively with your team to drive individual and group performance.</li> <li>Champion change management with your team.</li> <li>Ask the question “How does this create value for customers” when making decision</li> <li>Lead a “culture of compliance”&nbsp;</li> <li>Subject matter expert in AML compliance&nbsp;</li> <li>Partner with Financial Crimes and second line compliance partners to execute against Coinbase’s AML program</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for in you:</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree or 3+ years of experience within the Compliance field.</li> <li>2-3+ year of supervisory experience</li> <li>Working knowledge of financial laws, regulations, and guidelines (e.g., BSA, OFAC, FinCEN guidance)</li> <li>Positive energy on the future of crypto and Web3</li> <li>Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences</li> <li>Experience working computers and multiple software and database systems</li> <li>Ability to thrive in ambiguous environments</li> </ul> <p><strong>Nice to haves:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Compliance Industry certification (e.g. ACAMS)</li> <li>Advanced understanding of Google apps</li> <li>Project Management, Scrum, Agile, or Lean 6S certification/experience.</li> <li>Familiarity with the Coinbase suite of products<em><br></em></li> </ul> <p>Job #: G2708</p> <p>#LI-Onsite</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><span style="

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.description: <p><strong>QA Engineer, Mobile (Android)</strong></p> <p><strong>United States · Remote</strong></p> <p><strong>Contract | Full-Time Hours</strong></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>The Opportunity</strong></p> <p>To help scale Solana Mobile, we are seeking an QA Engineer, Android to join our team for a limited-length contract, starting in Summer 2025. The ideal candidate is a highly organized, versatile individual who is passionate about Software Engineering in Test on mobile platforms,&nbsp; that will shape Solana Mobile’s test infrastructure and onboard the next generation of Solana Mobile developers.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>You will</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design, develop, test and deploy new tools for the automation of Android app quality control.</li> <li>Build new Android libraries to improve review and test automation for Solana Mobile products.</li> <li>Take ownership of the release process for decentralized applications distributed on the Solana Mobile platform.</li> <li>Take ownership of manual testing of Android apps built by 3rd party developers.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>You ideally have</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience with at least one programming language such as Java, C++ or Kotlin.</li> <li>Proficiency using command-line tools such as Bash, Zsh or similar on Linux or OS X.</li> <li>Strong scripting skills for the purpose of automation within CI/CD infrastructure.</li> <li>Experience in the development of Android instrumentation tests, using JUnit, Espresso, UI Automator, or similar tooling.</li> <li>Experience working within a small engineering team that independently translates product requirements into execution and results.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelors or higher degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.</li> <li>Able to work remotely within US time zones. Offices available in New York City.</li> <li>Strong communications skills both written and verbal.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Who We Are</strong></p> <p>Solana is a high-performance blockchain that enables decentralized applications and systems to scale without sacrificing security. We are now expanding into the mobile space, with Solana Mobile, where we are working to bring Solana and web3 to the palm of your hand. We're preparing to launch our upcoming Seeker mobile device later this year, and we're looking for a talented individual to help bring our mobile vision to life.</p>

jobs.title: Partner 16, Deal Operations
jobs.description: <p>Founded in Silicon Valley in 2009 by Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz, Andreessen Horowitz (aka a16z) is a venture capital firm that backs bold entrepreneurs&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/news-content" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/news-content" data-sk="tooltip_parent">building the future</a>&nbsp;through technology. We are&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/portfolio" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/portfolio" data-sk="tooltip_parent">stage agnostic</a>. We invest in seed to venture to&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/growth/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/growth/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">growth-stage technology</a>&nbsp;companies, across&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/ai/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/ai/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">AI</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/bio-health/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/bio-health/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">bio + healthcare</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/consumer/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/consumer/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">consumer</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16zcrypto.com/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16zcrypto.com/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">crypto</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/enterprise/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/enterprise/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">enterprise</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/fintech/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/fintech/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">fintech</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/games" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/games" data-sk="tooltip_parent">games</a>, and companies building toward&nbsp;<a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://a16z.com/american-dynamism/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/american-dynamism/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">American dynamism</a>. a16z has $46B in assets under management across multiple funds.<br><br>We’ve established a team that <a href="https://a16z.com/about/">is defined by</a> respect for the entrepreneur and the company-building process; we know what it’s like to be in the founder’s shoes. We’ve invested in <a href="https://a16z.com/portfolio/">companies</a> like Affirm, Airbnb, Coinbase, Databricks, Devoted Health, Insitro, Figma, GitHub, Instacart, OpenSea, Roblox, Stripe, and Substack. Our team is at the forefront of new technology, helping founders and their companies impact and change the world.</p> <h2><strong>The Role</strong></h2> <p>a16z is growing and we are looking to bring on a dynamic operations partner for our investing team. This team is on the front lines of our mission and innovation, managing the a16z deal process, from initial inbound deals to partnership meetings. In this role, you will be responsible for the program management of our deal process and working cross-functionally with our investing team.&nbsp;</p> <p>We are looking for a strong program manager who can work autonomously to keep our deal process on track through strong organizational skills, being detail oriented, and working at the highest level of integrity and confidentiality. You will be working closely with all members of the investing team. jobs.title: Associate Manager, Compliance
jobs.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Ready to be pushed beyond what you think you’re capable of?</p> <p>At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom in the world. It’s a massive, ambitious opportunity that demands the best of us, every day, as we build the emerging onchain platform — and with it, the future global financial system.</p> <p>To achieve our mission, we’re seeking a very specific candidate. We want someone who is passionate about our mission and who believes in the power of crypto and blockchain technology to update the financial system. We want someone who is eager to leave their mark on the world, who relishes the pressure and privilege of working with high caliber colleagues, and who actively seeks feedback to keep leveling up. We want someone who will run towards, not away from, solving the company’s hardest problems.</p> <p>Our <a href="https://www.coinbase.com/mission">work culture</a> is intense and isn’t for everyone. But if you want to build the future alongside others who excel in their disciplines and expect the same from you, there’s no better place to be.</p> <p>While many roles at Coinbase are remote-first, we are not remote-only. In-person participation is required throughout the year. Team and company-wide offsites are held multiple times annually to foster collaboration, connection, and alignment. Attendance is expected and fully supported.</p></div><p>The Compliance team within Customer Experience (CX) is responsible for developing and delivering best in class support across multiple customer segments. The Global Compliance Operations Team is responsible for executing Compliance controls with adherence to Coinbase’s BSA/AML program, transaction monitoring, KYC, CDD, and EDD policies, procedures and standards appropriate for each jurisdiction in which Coinbase operates. As a Compliance Support Supervisor, you will lead a team of 10-15 Compliance Analysts responsible for enhanced due diligence (EDD), transaction monitoring, to include preparation and filing of Suspicious Activity Reports (SAR). The supervisor sets a culture of ownership and customer focus on their teams by supporting individual and team goals and ensuring best in class customer service experiences through the team. Supervisors also identify broader customer impacting issues and work with technical and nontechnical teams to implement solutions to drive quality and productivity of operations.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What you’ll be doing:</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Lead a team of 10-15 Compliance (Transaction Monitoring / AML and Fraud Investigations/EDD) Analysts;&nbsp;</li> <li>Ensure adherence to operational KPIs from directs and vendor partners&nbsp; or overall performance and the quality.&nbsp;</li> <li>Coordinate with senior management and provide insights for process improvement.</li> <li>Communicate effectively with your team to drive individual and group performance.</li> <li>Champion change management with your team.</li> <li>Ask the question “How does this create value for customers” when making decision</li> <li>Lead a “culture of compliance”&nbsp;</li> <li>Subject matter expert in AML compliance&nbsp;</li> <li>Partner with Financial Crimes and second line compliance partners to execute against Coinbase’s AML program</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for in you:</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree or 3+ years of experience within the Compliance field.</li> <li>2-3+ year of supervisory experience</li> <li>Working knowledge of financial laws, regulations, and guidelines (e.g., BSA, OFAC, FinCEN guidance)</li> <li>Positive energy on the future of crypto and Web3</li> <li>Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences</li> <li>Experience working computers and multiple software and database systems</li> <li>Ability to thrive in ambiguous environments</li> </ul> <p><strong>Nice to haves:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Compliance Industry certification (e.g. ACAMS)</li> <li>Advanced understanding of Google apps</li> <li>Project Management, Scrum, Agile, or Lean 6S certification/experience.</li> <li>Familiarity with the Coinbase suite of products<em><br></em></li> </ul> <h4><strong>Note: This role requires full-time, in-office presence at our Charlotte location.&nbsp;</strong></h4> <p>Job #: G2707</p> <p>#LI-Onsite</p><div class

jobs.title: Partner 18, Senior Program Manager, Cybersecurity
jobs.description: <p>Founded in Silicon Valley in 2009 by Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz, Andreessen Horowitz (aka a16z) is a venture capital firm that backs bold entrepreneurs&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/news-content" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/news-content" data-sk="tooltip_parent">building the future</a>&nbsp;through technology. We are&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/portfolio" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/portfolio" data-sk="tooltip_parent">stage agnostic</a>. We invest in seed to venture to&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/growth/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/growth/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">growth-stage technology</a>&nbsp;companies, across&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/ai/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/ai/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">AI</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/bio-health/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/bio-health/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">bio + healthcare</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/consumer/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/consumer/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">consumer</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16zcrypto.com/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16zcrypto.com/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">crypto</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/enterprise/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/enterprise/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">enterprise</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/fintech/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/fintech/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">fintech</a>,&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/games" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/games" data-sk="tooltip_parent">games</a>, and companies building toward&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://a16z.com/american-dynamism/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://a16z.com/american-dynamism/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">American dynamism</a>. a16z has $46B in assets under management across multiple funds.</p> <p>We’ve established a team that<a href="https://a16z.com/about/"> is defined by</a> respect for the entrepreneur and the company-building process; we know what it’s like to be in the founder’s shoes. We’ve invested in<a href="https://a16z.com/portfolio/"> companies</a> like Affirm, Airbnb, Coinbase, Databricks, Devoted Health, Insitro, Figma, GitHub, Instacart, OpenSea, Roblox, Stripe, and Substack. Our team is at the forefront of new technology, helping founders and their companies impact and change the world.</p> <h2>The Role&nbsp;</h2> <p>The Cybersecurity Program Manager will lead the planning, coordination, and execution of a16z’s cybersecurity program portfolio. Reporting to the Chief Information Security Officer, this role is responsible for managing the full lifecycle of security initiatives, driving clarity, accountability, and delivery across multiple concurrent workstreams. You will partner with teams across technical, operational, and business functions to ensure cybersecurity programs are executed effectively, risks are managed proactively, and security outcomes align with firm-wide priorities. This role will also own program reporting, including project status, risk summaries, and key metrics, to keep stakeholders and leadership informed and aligned.</p> <p>We are open to candidates based in the San Francisco Bay Area, CA. The role requires an in office presence at least 2 days a week in our Menlo Park, CA or San Francisco, CA office.&nbsp;</p> <h2>To join our team, you should be excited to:</h2> <ul> <li>Own and manage the cybersecurity program portfolio, including roadmap planning, intake, prioritization, and milestone tracking</li> <li>Lead the execution of cybersecurity initiatives in collaboration with cross-functional teams, ensuring alignment, accountability, and progress across technical, operational, and business domains</li> <li>Develop long-range plans and strategic objectives that balance day

jobs.title: Senior Protocol Engineer
jobs.location: New York, New York, United States, Remote, San Francisco, California, United States
jobs.description: <p>&nbsp;</p> <h3><strong>Who We Are:</strong></h3> <p>At Solana Mobile, we are working to bring Solana and web3 to the palm of your hand on mobile. In 2023 we shipped the Saga phone with Seed Vault to secure Solana wallets with HW backed security and built the dApp Store as a developer friendly place to bring web3 apps to users. We also implement and provide the Solana Mobile Stack to developers to simplify building web3 dApps for mobile. In 2025 we continued this journey with the release of Seeker, which has shipped to 150k customers in 50+ countries.</p> <h3><strong>The Role:</strong></h3> <p>To build the next chapter of Solana Mobile, we are seeking a Senior Protocol Engineer to join our team full-time. The ideal candidate is a highly organized, versatile individual who will build and ship Solana programs that will drive Solana Mobile’s ecosystem and drive adoption of the next generation of Solana Mobile developers and users.</p> <p>The core responsibility of this role is to build and own Solana programs that are instrumental for the health and growth of the Solana Mobile ecosystem. You will build unique on-chain programs for the purpose of token operations, including staking, voting and governance. You will work with backend engineers to build infrastructure and APIs to connect users, developers and decentralized gate-keepers of the Solana Mobile device ecosystem. You create efficiency for operations by stream-lining the monitoring of performance, stability and security of Solana Mobile’s infrastructure.</p> <h3><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Build and ship new Solana on-chain programs for staking, voting and governance, based on Rust.</li> <li>Create new APIs to securely interact with on-chain programs.</li> <li>Enhance the speed, performance, and reliability of existing web-based services driving the mobile application store and other core services.</li> <li>Implement and operate automated web deployments in a containerized application environment (AWS).</li> <li>Be ready to participate in on-call rotation.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <h3><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Proficiency coding Rust, with track record of smart contracts in production.</li> <li>Deep understanding of the Solana blockchain, its runtime and composability.</li> <li>Experience building scalable and fault-tolerant backend systems, including HTTP REST APIs, web services and data storage.</li> <li>Strong understanding of networking (OSI, NAT), computer science (common algorithms, space/time complexity), relational databases, common attack vectors (SQL injection, XSS), common engineering patterns (state machines, idempotency, optimistic locking) and cryptography.</li> <li>Working knowledge of Unix/Linux - processes, system calls, shell scripting.</li> <li>Experience working within a small team that independently translates product requirements into execution and results.</li> <li>Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or higher degree.</li> <li>3 years of work experience as Protocol Software Engineer.</li> <li>5 years of work experience as Backend Engineer.</li> <li>Able to work remotely within US time zones. Office available in New York City.</li> <li>Strong communications skills both written and verbal.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Nice to Haves:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Interest or experience in <strong>blockchain</strong> applications and ecosystem tools.</li> <li>Contributions to open-source Android or security-related projects.</li> </ul> <p><br><br></p> <p><em>Solana Mobile</em> <em>is an equal opportunity employer.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

This team sits at the heart of our infrastructure—responsible for bank integrations, payment connectivity, and a suite of business-critical services that ensure money moves reliably and securely across our platform.</p> <p>You'll lead a team of talented engineers focused on delivering robust, scalable, and compliant financial infrastructure. From integrating with global banking partners to powering real-time transaction flows, your work will directly impact the operational stability and financial accuracy of the entire business.</p> <p>This is a high-impact role ideal for someone who thrives in complex domains, values precision, and is motivated by the challenge of building systems that underpin the company’s trust and industries and with globally distributed teams and a no-job-too-small mentality</li> <li>Familiarity with supporting a sales organization and collaborating with sales executives and operational teams on incentive planning and performance</li> <li>Able to autonomously own, plan, and coordinate projects to accomplish a quality outcome on time and on budget</li> <li>Culture and engagement champion with experience managing change, engagement initiatives, and contributing to leadership strategic plans</li> <li>Previous experience with successful integration of acquired businesses is a plus, but jobs.title: Associate Manager, Transaction Monitoring Compliance
jobs.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Ready to be pushed beyond what you think you’re capable of?</p> <p>At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom in the world. It’s a massive, ambitious opportunity that demands the best of us, every day, as we build the emerging onchain platform — and with it, the future global financial system.</p> <p>To achieve our mission, we’re seeking a very specific candidate. We want someone who is passionate about our mission and who believes in the power of crypto and blockchain technology to update the financial system. We want someone who is eager to leave their mark on the world, who relishes the pressure and privilege of working with high caliber colleagues, and who actively seeks feedback to keep leveling up. We want someone who will run towards, not away from, solving the company’s hardest problems.</p> <p>Our <a href="https://www.coinbase.com/mission">work culture</a> is intense and isn’t for everyone. But if you want to build the future alongside others who excel in their disciplines and expect the same from you, there’s no better place to be.</p> <p>While many roles at Coinbase are remote-first, we are not remote-only. In-person participation is required throughout the year. Team and company-wide offsites are held multiple times annually to foster collaboration, connection, and alignment. Attendance is expected and fully supported.</p></div><p>The Compliance team within Customer Experience (CX) is responsible for developing and delivering best in class support across multiple customer segments. The Global Compliance Operations Team is responsible for executing Compliance controls with adherence to Coinbase’s BSA/AML program, transaction monitoring, KYC, CDD, and EDD policies, procedures and standards appropriate for each jurisdiction in which Coinbase operates. As a Compliance Support Supervisor, you will lead a team of 10-15 Compliance Analysts responsible for enhanced due diligence (EDD), transaction monitoring, to include preparation and filing of Suspicious Activity Reports (SAR). The supervisor sets a culture of ownership and customer focus on their teams by supporting individual and team goals and ensuring best in class customer service experiences through the team. Supervisors also identify broader customer impacting issues and work with technical and nontechnical teams to implement solutions to drive quality and productivity of operations.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What you’ll be doing:</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Lead a team of 10-15 Compliance (Transaction Monitoring / AML and Fraud Investigations/EDD) Analysts;&nbsp;</li> <li>Ensure adherence to operational KPIs from directs and vendor partners&nbsp; or overall performance and the quality.&nbsp;</li> <li>Coordinate with senior management and provide insights for process improvement.</li> <li>Communicate effectively with your team to drive individual and group performance.</li> <li>Champion change management with your team.</li> <li>Ask the question “How does this create value for customers” when making decision</li> <li>Lead a “culture of compliance”&nbsp;</li> <li>Subject matter expert in AML compliance&nbsp;</li> <li>Partner with Financial Crimes and second line compliance partners to execute against Coinbase’s AML program</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for in you:</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree or 5+ years of experience within the Compliance field.</li> <li>2-3+ year of supervisory experience</li> <li>Working knowledge of financial laws, regulations, and guidelines (e.g., BSA, OFAC, FinCEN guidance)</li> <li>Positive energy on the future of crypto and Web3</li> <li>Excellent communication skills (written and verbal), ability to simplify complex topics for broad audiences</li> <li>Experience working computers and multiple software and database systems</li> <li>Ability to thrive in ambiguous environments</li> </ul> <p><strong>Nice to haves:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Compliance Industry certification (e.g. ACAMS)</li> <li>Advanced understanding of Google apps</li> <li>Project Management, Scrum, Agile, or Lean 6S certification/experience.</li> <li>Familiarity with the Coinbase suite of products<em><br></em></li> </ul> <h4><strong>Note: This role requires full-time, in-office presence at our Charlotte location.&nbsp;</strong></h4> <p>Job #: G2707</p> <p>#LI-Onsite</p><div class

As the most trusted and fastest-growing global crypto company, it helps millions of people worldwide safely access cryptocurrency. Since its inception in 2011, Blockchain.com has earned the trust of over 90 million wallet holders and more than 40 million verified users, facilitating over $1 trillion in crypto transactions.</p></div><p><strong><a class="c-link" href="http://blockchain.com/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="http://Blockchain.com" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Blockchain.com</a>&nbsp;is the world’s leading platform for digital assets, powering billions in transactions and enabling global financial access.&nbsp;Offering the largest production blockchain platform in the world, we share the passion to code, create, and ultimately build an open, accessible and fair financial future, one piece of software at a time.</strong></p> <p>We’re seeking a&nbsp;<strong>Brand Designer</strong> with approximately <strong>4–5 years of experience</strong> to shape and elevate the institutional brand experience at Blockchain.com. You'll own the brand identity across all client touchpoints—from high-stakes product interfaces and landing pages to collateral used in high-touch institutional engagements. This is a high-impact role, working for one of the most influential financial services companies in crypto.</p> <p><strong>WHAT YOU WILL DO</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Brand Development &amp; Activation</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Define, expand, and uphold brand guidelines tailored for institutional audiences—ensuring consistency, clarity, and distinction across web, product, and collateral.<a href="https://builtin.com/job/brand-designer/2821520?utm_source=chatgpt.com">&nbsp;</a></li> <li>Develop visual assets for institutional materials: pitch decks, reports, executive presentations, and product collateral.</li> </ul> <li><strong>Web &amp; Product UI Design</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Design and optimize landing pages with a focus on conversions and clarity for institutional clients.</li> <li>Translate brand strategy into seamless visual and interaction design for institutional product interfaces (e.g., dashboards for trading, custody, structured products).</li> </ul> <li><strong>Creative Direction &amp; Execution</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Help create custom illustrations or graphic assets supporting product features, marketing, and thought leadership pieces.</li> <li>Collaborate and iterate closely with product, marketing, engineering, and stakeholder teams to deliver polished, high-quality execution across touchpoints.</li> </ul> <li><strong>Autonomous Design Ownership</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Work with high independence: from ideation to execution, owning design outcomes end-to-end.</li> <li>Communicate design rationale confidently to stakeholders, grounded in strategic and user-centered thinking.</li> </ul> </ul> <p><strong>WHAT YOU WILL NEED</strong></p> <ul> <li>4–5 years of brand or digital/UX design experience, preferably with exposure to fintech, financial services, B2B, or institutional audiences.<br>Proficiency in Figma (required); experience with Adobe Creative Cloud tools like Illustrator and Photoshop is a plus.</li> <li>A strong, versatile portfolio that showcases brand identity, web layouts, UI/UX, product interfaces, and illustration or custom graphics.</li> <li>Proven ability to execute designs for both web pages and product UIs, with an eye for detail, visual hierarchy, and brand consistency.</li> <li>Strong communication and presentation skills—comfortable engaging with cross-functional partners and translating business needs into well-crafted design systems.</li> </ul> <p><strong>NICE TO HAVE</strong></p> <ul> <li>Background in blockchain, crypto, or institutional financial services, or a strong interest in Web3.</li> <li>Video editing skills (Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro) for creating motion-rich presentations or dynamic brand content.</li> </ul> <p><strong>COMPENSATION &amp; PERKS</strong></p> <ul> <li>Competitive full-time salary based on experience and meaningful equity in an industry-lead

jobs.title: Principal Technical Program Manager
jobs.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">At Ripple, we’re building a world where value moves like information does today. It’s big, it’s bold, and we’re already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">If you’re ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.</span></p></div><h2><strong>The work:</strong></h2> <p>We’re seeking a dedicated, passionate, and eager Principal Technical Program Manager to join our team responsible for leading large cross-functional programs linked to our Products. This is a challenging and technical role, requiring the expertise to synthesize business and technical requirements and the foresight to ensure we are solving for Ripple’s current and future customer needs. You will work closely with our product and engineering teams to design robust and scalable systems, lead product schedules, remove roadblocks, and ensure high development velocity. Ideal candidates have a track record of seeing around the corner and providing technical leadership to deliver for customers. You will be responsible for high-level strategy, but also know when to get hands-on to push an initiative forward. You must be passionate about enabling teams to invent and deliver customer-focused solutions to bold and ambiguous challenges.</p> <h2><strong>What you'll do:</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Develop department-level priorities and strategy across our liquidity initiatives by understanding our customers and technology deeply.</li> <li>Reduce ambiguity and risk by proactively identifying and eliminating bottlenecks, raising issues strategically, and making sound data-driven decisions that deliver for our customers based on associated trade-offs.</li> <li>Communicate with purpose and clarity, bringing together cross-functional teams to achieve program objectives.</li> <li>Be a role model and an inspiring leader for other TPMs.</li> <li>Create technical frameworks that can be used by engineering teams for decision-making.</li> <li>Influence efficiency of Operation Excellence processes across the organization</li> <li>Partner with program managers, product managers, and engineering managers to understand development priorities and drive alignment across multiple partners with impactful priorities</li> <li>Proactively identify and mitigate risks and remove obstacles to impeding development achievements</li> <li>Drive testing dependencies for assigned engineering teams but also across teams as products converge for release</li> <li>Build release, bug, and supervising dashboards to advise partners of development progress and gaps</li> </ul> <h2><strong>What you'll bring:</strong></h2> <ul> <li>12+ years of previous release and/or project management experience on projects involving sophisticated enterprise tech environments working directly with many teams across functions.</li> <li>Ability to use data and analytics to look at trends and lead health of projects and systems</li> <li>Shown understanding and working knowledge of software development and modern project management standard processes, such as Agile, Scrum, Six Sigma, etc.</li> <li>Ability to coordinate multi-functionally, build consensus, and complete across teams. Able to influence without authority, negotiate and encourage others in a matrixed environment</li> <li>Experience with project planning tools such as Jira, Confluence, and a proficient user of Google Sheets</li> <li>Experience crafting or architecting (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems</li> <li>Experience in Payments, Custody, Stablecoin, and/or Blockchain ecosystems</li> </ul><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><span class="s1">For positions that will be based in NY, the annual salary range for this position is below. Actual salaries may vary based on numerous factors including, among other things, an individual applicant’s experience and qualifications for the position. This range does not include equity or additional compensation, such as bonuses or commissions.&nbsp;<br></sp

Attendance is expected and fully supported.</p></div><p>The Client Strategist (CS) team is a key function within Coinbase Asset Management (CBAM). At CBAM a CS’s job is to build the business. This includes engaging prospects and developing them into clients (if appropriate).&nbsp; At CBAM a Client Strategist is a hybrid between a salesperson and an investment strategist. A successful Client Strategist can secure the next 2-3 meetings during the initial conversation, and drive a deal towards funding. Post funding, Client Strategists design and deliver investor support, in concert with CBAM’s Director of Marketing and IR. It’s big, it’s bold, and we’re already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">If you’re ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.</span></p></div><div> <p><strong>THE WORK:</strong></p> <p>We’re looking for an experienced Product Marketer with a background in the blockchain, traditional finance, and decentralised finance (DeFi) to join our team.</p> <p>In this role, you will shape how Ripple’s institutional DeFi solutions are understood and adopted in the market. You’ll craft clear, differentiated positioning and lead go-to-market strategies that translate technical capabilities into compelling value for institutional audiences. This includes blockchain based solutions for payments, trade finance, collateral management, and more.</p> <p>The ideal candidate will have <strong>a deep understanding of traditional financial markets, strong experience leading product marketing for DeFi or crypto products</strong> in a constantly evolving environment.</p> <p><strong>WHAT YOU’LL DO:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Be the <strong>subject matter expert in our prospective markets, customer / partner segments, and the competitive landscape</strong>, forming data driven viewpoints on growth strategies and tactics.</li> <li>Develop <strong>segment-specific go-to-market strategies</strong> for Ripple’s institutional DeFi solutions – including defining and sizing target markets, influencing product strategy through deep market insights, developing a solid GTM foundation including clear value proposition and messaging.</li> <li>Working cross-functionally to own the strategy, coordination, and execution of <strong>new product features and partner</strong> <strong>launches</strong>.</li> <li><strong>Partner with our business development team</strong> to drive engagement and joint go to market opportunities with key infrastructure and utility ecosystem partners.</li> <li><strong>Partner with marketing, communications, and creative teams</strong> to bring the Institutional DeFi on XRPL story to life, activating the go to market strategy towards the right audience.</li> <li><strong>Partner with the Sales Enablement team</strong> to deliver high-quality, just-in-time enablement material or sessions to set our field team up for success.</li> </ul> </div> <div> <p><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BRING:&nbsp;</strong></p> </div> <div> <ul> <li>8+ years in Product Marketing, or in an equivalent role where you developed GTM strategy and drove execution of such strategy.</li> <li>Experience working in blockchain, crypto/web3, or institutional DeFi. Direct experience / expertise in stablecoins preferred.</li> <li>Outstanding structured thinking and creative problem solving skills.</li> <li>Proven ability to work independently, prioritize proactively, communicate effectively and deliver value iteratively to day-to-day responsibilities.</li> <li>Excel at developing differentiated positioning and simplifying sophisticated concepts into impactful messaging targeting a diverse audience.</li> <li>Strong relationship building capabilities and the ability to work cross-functionally</li> </ul> </div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><span class="s1">For positions that will be based in NY, the annual salary range for this position is below. This range does not include equity or additional compensation, such as bonuses or commissions.&nbsp;<br></span></div><div class="title">NY Annual Base Salary Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$170,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$200,000 USD</span>&

jobs.description: GiveWell is a research organization that identifies and funds cost-effective giving opportunities, focusing on global health and well-being. Our work is funded by tens of thousands of donors who rely on our research to inform their giving. Weâve grown from directing $1.5 million in 2010 to directing ~$400 million in 2024. The role As a Research Analyst on GiveWell's Commons team, you will support our broader research team in identifying cost-effective giving opportunities. Your work will contribute to GiveWellâs decisions about how hundreds of millions of dollars will be spent to save and improve the lives of people living in the lowest-income communities in the world. You will also play a key role in fulfilling our commitment to transparency and ensuring that the work we produce is accurate and high quality. jobs.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">At Ripple, we’re building a world where value moves like information does today. It’s big, it’s bold, and we’re already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">If you’re ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.</span></p></div><div> <p>THE WORK:</p> <p>Are you a seasoned Business Recruiter looking for a chance to define an impact? Look no further! Ripple is seeking a Senior Business Recruiter to join our dynamic team and help us bring in top talent to drive our growth and innovation forward. As the Senior Business Recruiter, you will be a crucial part of the recruiting process, owning the process from start to finish and partnering closely with hiring managers to identify, attract and retain top talent.</p> <p>In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a versatile team and play a key role in crafting the future of Ripple. You will work closely with our Talent Acquisition leader to build and implement a recruiting strategy that aligns with our strategic objectives while providing an outstanding candidate experience. Join us and be part of a company that is a leading provider of digital asset infrastructure for financial institutions</p> <p>WHAT YOU’LL DO:</p> <ul> <li>Own the recruiting process from sourcing to offers for multiple positions across the company.</li> <li>Develop strategies to meet hiring goals and work alongside hiring managers to align priorities and objectives</li> <li>Ensure great candidate experience keeping candidates advised and well-prepared throughout the entire process</li> <li>Partner with hiring managers to understand and meet their hiring needs</li> <li>Own and drive the intake meeting, interview team kick-off and debrief process for candidates</li> <li>Send weekly progress reports to hiring managers and senior leadership</li> </ul> </div> <div> <p>WHAT YOU'LL BRING:&nbsp;</p> </div> <div> <ul> <li>5+ years proven experience in recruiting, at least a few years in Business Recruiting</li> <li>A blend of agency and in-house startup experience is preferred</li> <li>Strong sourcing skills with a proven track of turning passive candidates into hires</li> <li>Experience using niche channels to source candidates, diversity and inclusion events, etc.</li> <li>Self-starter who enjoys fast-paced collaborative environment, great organization skills</li> <li>Experienced recruiter based in the New York City metro area with a strong background in traditional finance (TradFi); familiarity with decentralized finance (DeFi) is a plus.</li> <li>Experience using the tools of the trade: ATS systems (we use Greenhouse), LinkedIn, using social media, Gem, Github, other sourcing tools, etc.</li> <li>Ability to work “off” hours to support hiring managers, leaders and candidates across the globe.</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communications skills</li> </ul> <p>Bonus Points:</p> <ul> <li>Experience working and recruiting for a Fintech company</li> </ul> </div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><span class="s1">For positions that will be based in NY, the annual salary range for this position is below. This range does not include equity or additional compensation, such as bonuses or commissions.&nbsp;<br></span></div><div class="title">NY Annual Base Salary Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$112,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$135,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>WHO WE ARE:</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Do Your Best Work</span></p> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span

jobs.title: Consumer QA Analyst III
jobs.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Ready to be pushed beyond what you think you’re capable of?</p> <p>At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom in the world. It’s a massive, ambitious opportunity that demands the best of us, every day, as we build the emerging onchain platform — and with it, the future global financial system.</p> <p>To achieve our mission, we’re seeking a very specific candidate. We want someone who is passionate about our mission and who believes in the power of crypto and blockchain technology to update the financial system. We want someone who is eager to leave their mark on the world, who relishes the pressure and privilege of working with high caliber colleagues, and who actively seeks feedback to keep leveling up. We want someone who will run towards, not away from, solving the company’s hardest problems.</p> <p>Our <a href="https://www.coinbase.com/mission">work culture</a> is intense and isn’t for everyone. But if you want to build the future alongside others who excel in their disciplines and expect the same from you, there’s no better place to be.</p> <p>While many roles at Coinbase are remote-first, we are not remote-only. In-person participation is required throughout the year. Team and company-wide offsites are held multiple times annually to foster collaboration, connection, and alignment. Attendance is expected and fully supported.</p></div><p>The Coinbase Customer Experience (CX) organization is on a mission to provide the most trusted and value-added Customer Support in Crypto. Our team is dedicated to eliminating customer pain points, empowering our global user base via self-service and automation, and optimizing customer support interactions to create an effortless experience.&nbsp;</p> <p>As a Consumer QA Analyst III, you will serve as a subject matter expert, quality officer, and process engineer for specific lines of business (LOB). Aligned with our mission to deliver outstanding support, you will work closely with production QA teams to ensure compliance with audit requirements, generate actionable insights, and share key findings with stakeholders. You will lead quality programs aiming to enhance metrics for your assigned LOB, embodying the philosophy that QA professionals are catalysts for improvement and innovation, not just auditors.</p> <p><strong>Please note that this role is expected to report onsite in our US Center of Excellence office in Charlotte, NC.&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What you’ll be doing (ie. job duties):&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Full ownership of quality program: </strong>Govern the quality management of specific lines of business assigned to you. Ensure quality deliverables are done on time based on business requirements.</li> <li><strong>Analyze metric trends:</strong> Support our business operations by analyzing KPI trends and conduct root cause analysis. Surface agent and non-agent opportunities and work with different stakeholders (Workforce Management, Vendor Management, Operations, Learning &amp; Development, Content, Compliance, etc.) by proposing a solution and executing it.</li> <li><strong>Communicate quality issues</strong>: Present QA findings, insights, and recommendations persuasively to inspire positive change via business reviews and other channels with your stakeholders.</li> <li><strong>Manage quality projects and deployments:</strong> Work with the QA leaders in developing quality solutions for your LOBs which will help drive metric improvement.&nbsp;</li> <li><strong>Own dashboard management</strong>: Work with Analytics in developing and maintaining quality dashboards to monitor KPI movements.</li> <li><strong>Facilitate calibration sessions</strong>: Ensure productive discussions during calibration calls with production QAs, training facilitators, and operations. Drive alignment scores above expectations.</li> <li><strong>Handle disputes and escalations</strong>: Work with your stakeholders in managing audit disputes and misalignments. Clarify process grey areas and make in black and white in our agent SOPs. Prioritize critical escalations as needed and work with your stakeholders in minimizing such instances.</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>This role requires full-time, in-office presence at our Charlotte location.</strong></li> <li><strong>Relevant Experience: </strong>3+ years of experience in quality management in customer service operations.</li> <l

jobs.title: AI Evaluation Specialist
jobs.description:
Binance is a leading global blockchain ecosystem behind the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume and registered users. We are trusted by over 280 million people in 100+ countries for our industry-leading security, user fund transparency, trading engine speed, deep liquidity, and an unmatched portfolio of digital-asset products. Binance offerings range from trading and finance to education, research, payments, institutional services, Web3 features, and more. We leverage the power of digital assets and blockchain to build an inclusive financial ecosystem to advance the freedom of money and improve financial access for people around the world.


We are seeking a dedicated AI Evaluation Specialist responsible for designing, implementing, and managing comprehensive evaluation frameworks that span the entire lifecycle of LLM agents—from pre-deployment testing to post-deployment monitoring and iterative refinement. Your work will directly influence Binance’s AI adoption journey by ensuring the reliability, adaptability, and governance compliance of AI agents operating across various domains such as Customer Service, Growth, and Compliance.

Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + benefits (including medical, dental, and vision).</p></div>&l

jobs.title: Manager of Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU)
jobs.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Blockchain.com is connecting the world to the future of finance. As the most trusted and fastest-growing global crypto company, it helps millions of people worldwide safely access cryptocurrency. Since its inception in 2011, Blockchain.com has earned the trust of over 90 million wallet holders and more than 40 million verified users, facilitating over $1 trillion in crypto transactions.</p></div><p><strong>Blockchain.com is the world's leading software platform for digital assets. Offering the largest production blockchain platform in the world, we share the passion to code, create, and ultimately build an open, accessible and fair financial future, one piece of software at a time.</strong></p> <p>We are looking for an outstanding compliance professional to join our fast-growing team as the <strong>Manager of the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU).</strong> This role, reporting to the Chief Compliance Officer, will be responsible for overseeing Compliance operations for the function.&nbsp;</p> <p>We are looking for a highly motivated, adaptable, and collaborative professional who can handle ambiguity and enjoys building. As the <strong>Manager of the Financial Intelligence Unit</strong>, you will be responsible for managing the FIU, ensuring regulatory adherence and enabling efficiency and operational excellence. If you have experience in a fast-paced environment and are looking for an opportunity to be a member of an innovative compliance team in the cryptocurrency space, this is the perfect opportunity for you!</p> <p><strong>Role:</strong></p> <p>The Manager of the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) will oversee the implementation of effective compliance strategies, streamline operational processes, and maintain the highest standards of integrity while managing risk in a fast-evolving regulatory environment for cryptocurrency and blockchain technology.</p> <p><strong>WHAT YOU WILL DO:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Oversee the implementation of FIU day-to-day processes, ensuring full adherence to regulatory expectations and aligned with industry best practices.&nbsp;</li> <li>Maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of compliance operations, including alert volumes, false positive rates, and investigation times. Utilize an in-depth understanding of metrics, reporting, and capacity planning to make informed data-driven decisions.</li> <li>Develop and deliver dashboards and reports to senior management, regulators, and other stakeholders.</li> <li>Create and scale operational mechanisms to manage productivity, improve quality, and contribute to best-in-class operational processes.</li> <li>Develop, implement, and manage risk-based rules to ensure effective monitoring across diverse geographies and product offerings.</li> <li>Manage vendor relationships that support operational processes including transaction monitoring, screening, blockchain monitoring, etc.&nbsp;</li> <li>Leverage technology to automate workflows, implement operational efficiencies, and enhance operational scalability as the business grows.</li> <li>Build and manage a global team of compliance professionals responsible for investigation and filing regulatory reports and supporting other ad-hoc strategic compliance initiatives.</li> <li>Work closely across the Compliance team with MLROs and the Head of Financial Crimes Compliance, as well as cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Data, Legal, and others.</li> <li>Provide training, mentorship, and career development opportunities for team members.</li> <li>Foster a culture of compliance awareness, efficiency, and collaboration</li> <li>Act as a key liaison with regulators, auditors, and external advisors on transaction monitoring and sanctions compliance.</li> </ul> <p><strong>WHAT YOU WILL NEED:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Minimum of 5 years of relevant AML experience.</li> <li>Knowledge of the laws, regulations, and guidance governing AML / CFT, Sanctions / illicit finance and regulatory reporting</li> <li>Experience managing and implementing operational processes in crypto compliance, including using blockchain monitoring tools&nbsp;</li> <li>Comfort working in a global environment across time zones</li> <li>Experience working to drive programmatic and operational efficiencies using data and automation</li> <li>Ability to successfully manage competing priorities in a fast-paced tech-driven environment</li> regulated global business.</p> <p>This is a high-leverage leadership role: you will build the team from the ground up, own the evolution of a trusted identity data model decoupled from legacy systems, power identity, onboarding, and compliance capabilities across <em>all</em> Ripple products.</li> <li>Foundational scope: You’ll shape the platform that underpins trust, regulatory compliance, and customer activation globally.</li> <li>Global complexity: Build systems that work across multiple geographies, each with unique regulatory and operational needs.</li> <li>Strategic alignment: This geographies.</li> <li>Define and execute a technical roadmap balancing near-term delivery with long-term architectural durability.</li> <li>Champion engineering excellence in design, testing, security, observability, and operational practices.</li> </ul> </div> <div> <p><strong>WHAT YOU'LL BRING:&nbsp;</strong></p> </div> <div> <ul> <li>Proven track record as a Senior Engineering Manager (or equivalent) leading platform or identity-focused teams delivering complex, distributed systems.</li> <li>Domain expertise in identity, KYC/KYB, regtech, or compliance-heavy platforms — with hands-on delivery of mission-critical identity capabilities.</li> <li>Experience integrating major vendors into platform architectures while maintaining reliability, security, and compliance.</li> <li>Strength in guiding teams through complex system migrations and legacy decoupling.</li> <li>Skilled at aligning diverse stakeholders — across engineering, product, compliance, and legal — into a coherent technical strategy.</li> <li>Proven ability to deliver platforms with uncompromising rel

We want someone who is eager to leave their mark on the world, who relishes the pressure and privilege of working with high caliber colleagues, and who actively seeks feedback to keep leveling up. We want someone who will run towards, not away from, solving the company’s hardest problems.</p> <p>Our <a href="https://www.coinbase.com/mission">work culture</a> is intense and isn’t for everyone.
